hero.title: Mathematics Learning Path
hero.subtitle: A comprehensive journey through core mathematics topics, from foundational concepts to advanced applications.

content.text: The Mathematics learning path is designed to build a complete understanding of core mathematical topics. Starting with algebra and progressing through geometry, calculus, and statistics, each topic builds upon previous knowledge.
This path is suitable for students seeking comprehensive mathematical education, from high school through early undergraduate level.

articles.title: Algebra
articles.content: The language of mathematics. Learn to work with variables, equations, functions, and polynomials. Algebra is the foundation for all advanced mathematics.

articles.title: Geometry
articles.content: The mathematics of space and shape. Explore triangles, circles, polygons, and three-dimensional figures. Understand spatial relationships and proofs.

articles.title: Calculus
articles.content: The mathematics of change. Study limits, derivatives, integrals, and series. Calculus is essential for understanding rates of change and accumulation.

articles.title: Statistics
articles.content: The mathematics of data. Learn probability, distributions, inference, and correlation. Statistics is crucial for understanding data and making evidence-based decisions.

content.text: Follow these steps for effective learning:

items: Start with Algebra—establish your mathematical foundation
Study Calculus—understand the mathematics of change
Complete Statistics—learn to work with data
